Phishing(AttackEvent).description: A PhisingAttack Event happens when an attacker imitates another entity, in an attempt to get a victim to access malicious materials, such as a website or attachments.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event, such as: 'attack', 'purports to be', 'dupe', 'masquerading as', 'pretending to be', 'scam',...
attributes.attack-pattern: How was the attack triggered, such as 'opening something' or 'clicking somewhere'.
attributes.damage-amount: The amount of damage done to the victim.
attributes.purpose: What wants to steal the attacker, such as 'information'.
attributes.time: When did the attack occurred, such as 'today', 'tomorrow', ...
attributes.attacker: The person or organization behind the attack.
attributes.tool: The tool used to send the attack, such as 'email', 'website', 'file'.
attributes.trusted-entity: The bait, i.e., what the tool pretended (purported) to be.

Ransom(AttackEvent).description: A RansomAttack Event happens when n attacker breaks into a system and encrypts data, and will only decrypt the data for a ransom payment.

attributes.mention:
The text span that triggers the event, such as:
    'attack', ransomware', 'selling', 'ransom', ...
attributes.attack-pattern: What does the attack do until demands are met.
attributes.damage-amount: The amount of damage the attack produced.
attributes.payment-method: How the payment have to be done, such as 'a webpage.

Databreach(AttackEvent).description: A DatabreachAttack Event happens when an attacker compromises a system to later remove or expose data, e.g., to sell, publish, or make it accessible.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event, such as: 'attack', 'expose', 'publish', 'steal', ...
attributes.attacker: The agent (person or organization) of the attack.
attributes.number-of-victim: The number of victims affected by the attack.
attributes.victim: The device, organization, person, product or website victim of the attack
attributes.purpose: The reason or purpose behind the attack.
attributes.damage-amount: The amount of damage done to the victim.
attributes.tool: The file, malware or website used to attack.

Discovervulnerability(VulnerabilityRelat.description: A VulnerabilityDiscover Event happens when a security expert or other entity, like a company, finds a software vulnerability.

attributes.mention:
The text span that triggers the event, such as:
    'attack', 'found', 'exploit', 'vulnerability', ...
attributes.vulnerable_system_version: The version of the vulnerable system.
attributes.capabilities: What is the vulnerability used for such as 'allow to take control'.
attributes.discoverer: The entity that reported the vulnerability.
attributes.vulnerable_system_owner: The owners of the vulnerable systemr.
attributes.supported_platform: The platforms that support the vulnerability.
attributes.vulnerable_system: The systems vulnerable to the vulnerability.

Patchvulnerability(VulnerabilityRelatedE.description: A VulnerabiltyPatch Event happens when  software company addresses a known vulnerability by releasing or describing an appropriate update.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event, such as:'patch', 'fixed', 'addresses', 'implemented','released', ...
attributes.vulnerable_system_version: The version of the vulnerable system.
attributes.time: When was the patch implemented, the date.
attributes.patch-number: Nunber or name of the patch.
attributes.supported_platform: The platforms that support the vulnerability.
